direction.raw_text: A group of British soldiers, in shorts and tropical gear, are gathered tensely around a piece of radar equipment, which is tracking a target. The radar operator says something to another soldier, who turns and speaks excitedly into a field telephone. (It is 5:00 a.m.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The microphone bears the word CALCUTTA. An Indian announcer, his expression one of excitement and terror, jabbers into the mike in a native tongue. A clock on the wall indicates that it is 2:26
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (STOCK) - NIGHT The plane is identified by a red star on the fuselage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The radioman is tracking an object on his radar scope. He points it out excitedly to the pilot. The pilot adjusts his microphone and starts making a report back to his base in Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - NIGHT A group of French farmers is collected around a radio, listening wide-eyed to the keyed-up voice which is telling them, in French, of a strange object that has been seen in the sky. They exchange uneasy glances. One old man crosses himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RIGHT SECTION OF SCREEN SHOWS INT. AMERICAN RADIO STATION - DAY A breathless American radio reporter is speaking into his mike, but we can't hear what he's saying. On the wall behind him is a clock which reads 3:32.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRITISH RADIO STATION - NIGHT A clock shows the time to be 8:32. The British announcer tries to maintain his traditional BBC calm, but finds it almost impossible to control his excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This announcer keeps talking, but his voice fades out, and now we hear the words the American announcer is saying...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LEFT SECTION OF SCREEN SHOWS INT

dialogue.raw_text: Reports are coming in from all over the Empire -- from all over the world. The Government have not yet issued a statement, but there seems to be no question that there actually is a large, unidentified object circling the earth at incredible speed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staccato with excitement) We still don't know what it is or where it's from - but we do know there's something there. It's been tracked around the world by radar traveling at a rate of four thousand miles an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The driver and his fare are listening intently to the radio, as we hear the voice of another radio reporter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (voice off scene) This is not another "flying saucer" scare. Scientists and military men have already agreed on that. Whatever this is -- it's something real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The attendant, who is filling a car with gas, leans around to hear the car's radio, oblivious to the fact that the car's tank is overflowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music builds to a climax and ends.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (voice off scene) We interrupt this program to give you a bulletin just received from one of our naval units at sea. "A large object, traveling at supersonic speed, is headed over the North Atlantic toward the east coast of the United States."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (with deliberately controlled calm) Here in the nation's capital, there is anxiety and concern, but no outward sign of panic. As a matter of fact, there are signs of normalcy that seem strangely out of place; the beautiful spring weather, the tourist crowds at the various monuments and public buildings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A small crowd of tourists is climbing the steps to the columned entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under this shot a barely audible, distant hum is heard. It grows in volume so imperceptibly in this and the next two shots that we are unconscious of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT. THE MALL - LONG SHOT Crowds are strolling on the Mall and across the well-kept lawns in front of the Smithsonian Institution with the leisurely, meandering quality that distinguishes sight-seers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Including several small groups of people moving toward the Smithsonian. Their attention is attracted as the hum off scene becomes a roar. The sound is unearthly in its intensity and almost unbearable in its swiftly increasing volume. The people stop in their tracks and look up in the sky in terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Several people on the steps of the Smithsonian have turned to look. There is cold, frozen fear in their eyes. The awful sound keeps increasing in volume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man, following the progress of a huge object in the sky with his eyes. He is held terror-stricken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A giant shape, still at some distance, is approaching the earth at incredible speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group of people run wildly across a large expanse of lawn. A huge shadow cast from above onto the grass seems to be pursing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The great shape is considerably nearer now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of a woman, thoroughly shaken, held immobile by what she sees and hears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People scatter madly in all directions as the huge spaceship comes in for a landing on a smooth, grassy area. The tremendous roar of its motors is suddenly cut off and the great ship settles gently to a perfect landing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gleaming surface of the ship shows no break of any kind -- no windows, no ports, not even the outline of a hatch. It is a fearsome, terrifying object, giving no evidence of its source or its intention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - (FROM PARALLEL) Shooting down on a section of lawn, showing the varying reactions of people to the landing. Some are still running madly away; others, singly and in little groups, stand as though rooted, staring at the ship from a respectful distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he stares at the ship with fascination and horror. He'd like to run but he can't. His mouth twitches and he emits a nervous little laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT A woman is holding a two-year-old child by the hand as she watches the ship, awe-struck. Several people run past them. Suddenly the woman grabs up the child with a little sob, turns and runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A middle-aged man runs up to a group of several people, pointing wildly toward the ship and yelling irrationally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs off toward another group as we--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're here! They're here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A series of short DISSOLVES showing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A man dashing up to a crowded Washington street corner shouting wildly and gesticulating in the direction from which he came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Policemen piling into squad cars, which roar out of their garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Soldiers rushing out of a barracks at Fort Myer, with rifles and side arms, to form up on their company street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Newspaper presses rolling at high speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Newscasters chattering excitedly into their microphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A large telephone switchboard with the girls in a frenzy of activity as they try to handle the calls pouring in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The players are standing on the field in the crowded stadium, but the game has been interrupted and everyone is listening to the voice on the loudspeaker system. (Actual stock shot would be coverage of some dedication or ceremonial.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Brigadier General speaks in clipped tones into the telephone. There are a couple of other officers in the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Get me the Chief of Staff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S. SENATE OR HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES (STOCK) A shot, if one is available, of either House listening raptly as an announcement of great import is read by the Chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A distinguished-looking government official speaks into the phone with a sense of subdued urgency.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want to speak to the President. (listens for a moment) I'm sorry -- you'll have to interrupt him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A nationally known news commentator -- for purposes of this script let's say Drew Pearson -- is seated before a radio mike. He is also being photographed by TV cameras. In a wall near him is a TV screen which shows what is going out on the air. During the ensuing speech, a man comes in a hands him a sheaf of news bulletins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen, this is Drew Pearson. We bring you this special radio-television broadcast to give you the latest information on the landing of the "space ship" in Washington.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Government and Defense Department officials are concerned by reports of panic in several large Eastern cities. I am authorized to assure you that so far there is no reasonable cause for alarm. The rumors of invading armies and mass destruction are based on hysteria and are absolutely false. I repeat -- these rumors are absolutely false!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PEARSON The ship, designed for travel outside the earth's atmosphere, landed in Washington today at 3:47 p.m., Eastern Standard Time. We still don't know where it came from, but I can reveal that military leaders are considering two possibilities; that it came from some unfriendly power here on earth -- or that it actually arrived from another planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S to and DOLLIES IN on the TV screen in the wall. On the screen is a shot of the space ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) The ship is resting exactly where it landed two hours ago, and there has been no sign of life from inside it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on the TV screen. The cuts that follow are inside the frame of the screen:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two platoons of infantry soldiers surround the ship, their rifles at the ready.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) Troops have been rushed from Fort Myer and they have formed a cordon around the ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: showing two machine guns, two Sherman tanks and two 75MM guns. The gun crews are posted for action and all weapons are trained on the space ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) They are supported by machine guns, tanks and artillery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cops are holding back a section of a large crowd, some distance away from the ship. The people are wide-eyed and tense with excitement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) Behind police lines, there is a large crowd of curiosity seekers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: 1. Civilians in the crowd, their eyes and nerves taut with suspense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A young soldier, who grips his rifle and moistens his lips nervously, his eyes never leaving the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A tank commander blinks from the tension of staring at an unmoving object.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The last cut is of the ship itself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) As you can see for yourself, the Army has taken every precaution to meet whatever the situation may require. Every eye -- every weapon -- is trained on the ship. It's been this way for two hours and the tension--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he interrupts himself excitedly, his attention riveted on the TV screen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just a minute, ladies and gentlemen! I think I see something moving!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - DAY We are at the actual location now, not looking at TV. We see the ship surrounded by soldiers, two medium tanks, two artillery pieces, and a couple of machine guns. Some distance away is a suggestion of the crowd of civilians, held back by police. Prominent in the scene are newsreel and television cameras. OUR CAMERA MOVES IN to MED. SHOT. As it does so, we see a couple of metal objects rising slowly from the top of the ship. One, which is an oddly-designed coil of wire, slides up and revolves slowly. The other is a section of vented pipe with a convex cap on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the soldiers, their eyes glued to this first sign of activity from the ship. They shift uneasily, gripping their rifles more firmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a long, tense moment, a ramp appears silently out of the side of the ship and slides down to the ground. There is an audible gasp as a man appears at the top of the ramp. He looks around at the crowd with cool and imperturbable dignity. This is KLAATU. He is completely human in appearance. The only unearthly thing about him is his clothing. He wears a tunic that is very good looking, but at the same time thoroughly comfortable and practical. On his head is a metal helmet that obscures most of his face. (It would be impossible to identify him later.) The design of this helmet gives the impression that it is more a formal headdress than for protection. Klaatu is above all an impressive man -- a man of tremendous dignity and presence. He has the tolerant superiority that comes with absolute knowledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of soldiers, people in the crowd, and policemen. The newsreel and TV men are busy at their cameras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU After an impressive moment, he raises his arms in the universal gesture of neutrality. Then he speaks, in perfect English, his voice amplified as though through an enunciator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu walks slowly down the ramp toward the soldiers. As he does so, he draws from inside his tunic a strange looking object, longish and tubular. It might be a a telescope -- or it might be some strange kind of weapon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We have come to visit you in peace -- and with good will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shooting from the side, showing Klaatu advancing slowly toward the line of soldiers. He holds out the mysterious object in front of him in a gesture that is actually one of offering but could be misinterpreted as menacing. There is a growing, uneasy rumble of muttering among the soldiers as Klaatu advances. They are clearly frightened of what he may do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young second lieutenant, standing in front of his platoon. As Klaatu advances, the lieutenant unslings his carbine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu starts toward the platoon leader, raising the object he holds toward the man, trying to make clear his intentions. Misinterpreting this as a menacing gesture, the platoon leader raises his carbine to his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT of one of the tank commanders in the turret of his tank. He is watching Klaatu advancing toward the platoon leader and he has drawn his pistol. Convinced that the lieutenant is in jeopardy, the tank commander aims at Klaatu and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu falls to the ground wounded. The object he was holding has dropped from his hand and smashed. The soldiers start to gather around Klaatu excitedly when suddenly there appears in the entrance to the space ship a huge robot. There is a gasp of amazement from the crowd and the solders draw back at sight of him. The robot is ten feet tall, is made in the almost-perfect image of a man. He is to be played by an actor and his flesh appears to be made of a greenish metal. His eyes flash as though lighted internally. His perfectly- fashioned, muscular body is covered only with a loincloth. This is GORT. There are cries of amazement as Gort walks slowly ponderously, down the ramp to the ground. As he does so, the ramp closes behind him. Gort's face is, and always remains, utterly expressionless. He stops to look at Klaatu, lying on the ground. Then he looks around at the soldiers, the tanks and guns. All the guns have been traversing to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside him there comes an ominous crackling sound, as though power were being generated within him. His eyes flash toward the tank from which Klaatu was shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - TANK There is a great metallic clatter and the Sherman tank is suddenly reduced to a pile of junk metal, its parts completely disintegrated. Only a piece of tank track and twisted gun barrel emerge from the heap on the ground to identify what had been there. The tank's crew has remained unharmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crackling sound continues as his eyes start to sweep in a semicircle taking in all the troops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gort, with the back of his head in f.g., CAMERA PANS to follow Gort's sweeping gaze. In a growing crash and clatter of metal, every weapon in sight is destroyed. The two machine guns are little heaps of junk. The 75's are larger heaps. The second tank, like the first, is a three-foot pile of scrap. Rifles have dropped from the soldier's hands and lie on the ground as little mounds of wood and metal. None of the men has been harmed, but their faces show the utter terror of what they have experienced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they react to the full shock of what has happened. Most of them stand rooted to the ground. Several laugh hysterically. A few break and run wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sudden pandemonium breaks out. Utterly terrified by what they have witnessed, the crowd becomes a wild, milling, screaming mob, concerned only with escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - GORT He is walking slowly, deliberately, menacingly toward the tank commander who fired on Klaatu. Standing by the debris of his tank, the man is immobilized with terror. The robot starts to reach out to grab him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lying on the ground. He speaks to Gort sharply, in a strange language.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gort! Deglet ovrosco!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - GORT He pauses obediently in the act of reaching out for the tank commander. Dropping his arms, he stands motionless and remains that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU He has raised himself to a sitting position on the ground, his wounded shoulder giving him considerable pain. The two platoon leaders come into scene hesitantly, badly shaken by the awesome demonstration of power they have seen. They are uncertain as to what they should do. The platoon leader eyes the smashed object on the ground curiously and turns questioningly to Klaatu. With great dignity, Klaatu picks up the broken object, which we see well for the first time. It is a delicately-made tubular telescope, badly smashed. On it are indications of small electronic gadgets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu lets the object drop with a shrug of mild exasperation. The two lieutenants exchange a helpless look of bewilderment. Then Klaatu raises himself to his feet painfully, holding his wounded shoulder. As he does so, a colonel and a captain come into scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three junior officers exchange ineffectual glances and look to the colonel, who thinks for a moment before making his decision.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It was a gift. For your President. (glances at the broken object ruefully) With this he could have studied life on other planets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the lieutenants) Is he all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got hit in the shoulder, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Send for an ambulance. Get him to Walter Reed Hospital right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is a door to the corridor and a door to Klaatu's room. In the small sitting room, talking in tones of hushed concern, is a group of men. There's a Major General, a likable man with a chest full of ribbons. There are also a Colonel in command of the hospital, a high-ranking police officer, a couple of medical officers and two civilians. The conversation is interrupted by the entrance from Klaatu's room of a Medical Corps Major, followed by an Army Nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door to the corridor opens and a worried young Captain enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel turns, in deference, to the General.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley appears in the doorway, a brief case under his arm. He's a dignified, intelligent member of the White House secretariat. He proceeds uninterruptedly into the room, nodding cordially to the General.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley proceeds in businesslike fashion to the door. He knocks and then enters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Major) How is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's all right, General... Blood pressure's a little high, but it could be aggravation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wryly) Can't blame him. I always get mad when somebody shoots me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He still wants to see the President.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to General) We informed the White House over an hour ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Major) Didn't drop any hints about where he's from, did he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir, he didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me. (to the Colonel) What about the reporters, Colonel? They're swarming all over the lobby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Tell them there won't be any statement tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir. (glancing down the corridor) Mr. Harley's here from the White House.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: General -- GENERAL (indicating Klaatu's room) Right in there, Mr. Harley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Harley enters, closing the door behind him. Klaatu no longer wears his helmet and we see his face clearly for the first time. Even sitting up in bed, with his shoulder strapped in bandages, he is a figure of great authority. His face reflects inner dignity and assurance. Harley, who is a hardened diplomatist, can't help being impressed by his present assignment and a little awed by Klaatu. Harley obviously has been sent by the President to find out what he can. Klaatu's eyes study him, cool, penetrating, reserved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somewhat relieved, Harley seats himself. He speaks with a half smile, hoping to ease the tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley glances at him quickly to be sure he's not joking. He's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley reacts, as his wildest assumptions are so blandly corroborated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley smiles. Then his mind reverts to the seriousness of the situation and he speaks gravely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harley is thoroughly shaken. The tremendous force and power implicit in Klaatus's manner preclude the possibility of argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Growing a little impatient with such nonsense, Klaatu eyes him evenly, speaks with Jovian authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eyes of the two men meet for a long, silent moment. Then Harley rises quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and goes out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Harley -- Secretary to the President (Klaatu continues to study him silently) I've been told that you speak our language -- that your name is Mr. Klaatu.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coolly) Just Klaatu.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The President asked me to convey his deepest apologies for what has happened. We all feel--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) Sit down, Mr. Harley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure I don't have to point out that your arrival was something of a surprise. (getting a little smile from Klaatu, he is encouraged to do some fishing) Had you been traveling long?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About five months -- your months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must have come a long way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About 250 million of your miles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naturally we're very curious to know where it is you come from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (easily; he's a diplomat, too) From another planet. Let's just say that we're neighbors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's rather difficult for us to think of another planet as a neighbor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid, in the present situation you'll have to learn to think that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyebrows raised) The present situation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean the reasons for my coming here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (his eagerness apparent) We're very curious about that, too. Would you care to talk about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd be glad to. (noticing that Harley is settling himself expectantly) Not now, of course -- with you alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps you'd rather discuss it personally with the President--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (somewhat sharply) This is not a personal matter, Mr. Harley. It concerns all the people on your planet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Startled by the scope of this statement)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure I understand--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to meet with representatives from all the nations of the Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked and perturbed by this notion) I'm afraid that would be a little awkward. It's -- it's completely without precedent. And there are practical considerations -- the time involved -- the enormous distances.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coolly) I traveled 250 million miles. What about your United Nations?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Surprised and a little puzzled) You know about the United Nations?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've been monitoring your radio broadcasts for a good many years. That's how we learned your languages. Lately, we've been getting your television also.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wryly) You must have a rather strange impression of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) The first two years of television we were convinced that all you did was wrestle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure you recognize from our broad- casts the evil forces that have produced the tension in our world. Surely you would agree--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) I am not concerned, Mr. Harley, with the internal affairs of your planet. I consider that to be your business -- not mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was only hoping to make you understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sternly, impressively) My mission here is not to solve your petty squabbles. It concerns the existence of every last creature who lives on Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uncomfortably) Perhaps if you could explain a little--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I intend to explain. To all the nations -- simultaneously. (his manner precludes opposition) How do we proceed, Mr. Harley?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a long thoughtful moment) We could call a special meeting of the General Assembly... But of course the UN doesn't represent all of the nations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why not a meeting of all the Chiefs of State?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (helplessly, but patiently) Believe me, you don't understand. They wouldn't sit down at the same table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to resort to threats, Mr. Harley. I simply tell you bluntly that the future of your planet is at stake... I suggest you transmit that message to the nations of the Earth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will make that recommendation to the President. (he picks up his brief case and hat) I must tell you in all honesty that I'm extremely dubious about the results.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a half-smile) Apparently I'm not as cynical about Earth's people as you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been dealing in Earth's politics a good deal longer than you have. (he bows) Goodnight, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He stares after Harley for a moment, puzzled by this strange and apparently unreasoning world he has come to. He shakes his head in thoughtful, tolerant bewilderment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Searchlights have lighted up up the eerie shapes of the space ship and Gort. A circle of soldiers guard the area, while a crew of men can be seen working around the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - AT SHIP A Master Sergeant of Engineers, dressed in fatigues, is inspecting the side of the ship carefully. He has an acetylene torch in his had and a welding helmet over his face. The Major General, previously seen in the hospital sitting room, enters and speaks to the Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man named Carlson, a civilian metallurgical expert, comes into scene. The General nods to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Getting any place, Sergeant?

dialogue.raw_text: The skeletal structure is completely normal. (pointing) Same for the major organs - heart, liver, spleen, kidneys.

dialogue.raw_text: How does he explain that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says their medicine is that much more advanced. (the major stares at him blankly) He was very nice about it. But he made me feel like a third-class witch doctor.

dialogue.raw_text: What about it?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it downstairs and have it analyzed. (on his way to the door, shaking his head) Then I don't know whether I'll just get drunk or give up the practice of medicine.

dialogue.raw_text: Afternoon, Mr. Harley.

direction.raw_text: Harley extends a sheaf of cables for Klaatu's inspection, but he ignores them. Klaatu has listened to this recital, first incredulously, then with mounting indignation. Conscious of his quiet, Olympian wrath, Harley continues uncomfortably.

direction.raw_text: Reluctantly Harley has picked up his hat and brief case. He finds Klaatu staring out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good afternoon. (surprised not to find him in bed) I'm glad to see you up and around.

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you... Have you any news?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not very good news, I'm afraid. (digs into his briefcase for some papers) The President accepted your suggestion and cabled the invitations for a meeting last night. (grimly) Let me read you some of the replies. (he selects a cable and reads) "The Premier wishes to inform the Government of the United States that it will be impossible for him to attend the meeting suggested by the President unless the meeting is held in Moscow." (with a grimly-pointed glance at Klaatu, Harley reads another cable) "The suggestion of the President regarding the possibility of a meeting in Moscow would be unacceptable to Her Majesty's Government at the present time. Representation could be sent only if the meeting were held in Washington." (he looks up at Klaatu and shrugs) Well -- there you have it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I tried to make you understand. The suspicions -- the jealousies -- the mistrust-- (uneasily, under Klaatu's level gaze) Surely you realize that my government has done everything in its power--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your government I'm thinking about. It's your world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now that you understand the situation more clearly, perhaps you'd like to discuss the matter with the President
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sternly) I will not speak to any one nation or group of nations. (sharply, bitterly) I don't intend to add my contribution to your childish jealousies and suspicions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our problems are very complex, Mr. Klaatu. You mustn't judge us too harshly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can judge only by what I see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your impatience is quite understandable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) I am impatient with stupidity. My people have learned to live without it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ruefully) I'm afraid my people haven't. (with real sincerity) I'm very sorry -- I wish it were otherwise.

The nurse pauses as the M.P. takes out a key and inserts it in the lock of Klaatu's door. To his surprise he finds that the door is not locked. He exchanges a glance with the nurse, then pulls the door open and hurries inside.

It is unmade and unoccupied. Terrified, the M.P. turns to the nurse, who is standing in the doorway. M.P.  He's gone! The M.P. dashes out of the room, through the doorway past the nurse. result.heading: "MAN FROM MARS" ESCAPES FROM ARMY HOSPITAL

direction.raw_text: . A street corner newsstand, with people eagerly grabbing papers. The headline reads: "MAN FROM MARS" ESCAPES FROM ARMY HOSPITAL!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Radio announcers chattering excitedly into their microphones
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A series of close-ups of people listening to the radio. Their faces reveal their awestruck terror.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - NIGHT CAMERA is on the back of a man dressed in a business suit, who is walking along the sidewalk of a dimly lighted, almost deserted, middle-class street. He carries a suitcase and he glances idly at the drab-looking stone facades of the old two-story houses. As he passes, from the open windows of the houses come the voices of radio announcers. We get a sentence or two from one house and then, as the man and our CAMERA pass on, this voice fades and another is picked up. We get the impression that everyone is glued to his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --these fantastic descriptions of the creature are denounced as rumor by police Chief Walter Baxter. He is not eight feet tall, as reported -- nor does he have tentacles in place of arms-- --there's no denying that there is a monster at large -- that we are dealing with forces beyond our knowledge and power. The public is urged to take ordinary precautions and to remain calm, as we await further developments-- --three separate reports of people who claim to have seen the "space man" in the past hour. One from Des Moines, Iowa; one from a village in northern Florida; and one from Chicago.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) --authorities at Walter Reed Hospital refused to comment on how he managed to escape, or what measures might be taken to apprehend him.

He raises his right arm to scratch his head thoughtfully, and notices for the first time a small tag, or ticket, attached to the inside of the right forearm of the coat he is wearing. Puzzled, he pulls off the ticket and looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is the sort of tag a cleaning establishment attaches to clothing. Printed on it is the legend: CAPITOL DRY CLEANING SERVICE. Scrawled in a penciled hand is the notation: Dr. Carpenter, Bldg. A - Walter Reed Hospital. Cl. & pr. $1.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles wryly at this reminder of where he got the suit, and he destroys the ticket. He glances down at the suitcase beside him.

direction.raw_text: There 's no light in the room except what splashes in from the hall. Gathered around a television set are five adults and a little boy, their faces eerie in the reflected light from the screen. The room is done in average boardinghouse style -- antimacassars and all. The attention of the people is riveted on the television screen, where a newscaster is reading a bulletin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --while the President made no effort to minimize the crisis, he urged people all over the country to remain calm. He said the entire facilities of FBI and other federal agencies are being bought to bear. He pointed out, however, that this is no ordinary man hunt. He warned we may be up against powers that are beyond our control.

dialogue.raw_text: . CROCKETT (tensely) I can't stand any more of this. It's enough to drive a person crazy.

direction.raw_text: BOBBY BENSON, a bright-eyed, eleven-year-old, is seated beside his mother, HELEN BENSON, an attractive girl of thirty. Disappointed that the set has been turned off, Bobby's roving eye has fallen on something in the doorway to the hall... Wide-eyed, he nudges his mother and points.

direction.raw_text: including the doorway to the hall. Silhouetted motionless against the light from the hall is the figure of a man. All eyes follow Hobby's pointed finger, and there is a stifled gasp as they are startled out of their preoccupation. One of the men turns on the lights and Klaatu is revealed standing calmly in the doorway. There is a shocked silence for a moment, then Mrs. Crockett speaks.

direction.raw_text: Five of the boarders -- Mr. and Mrs. Barley, Mr. Krull, Helen Benson and Klaatu - are finishing their Sunday morning breakfast. Mrs. Barley is a middle-class Helen Hokinson lady, form and unrelenting. Her husband is a born complainer. Mr. Krull is a shriveled little accountant, precise and finicky. As they finish their coffee, all except Helen are immersed in the Sunday papers. Helen seems preoccupied with her own thoughts. From a portable radio on the table comes Gabriel Heater's voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --and so, this Sunday morning, we ask the question that's been plaguing; the entire nation for two days now: "Where is this creature and what is he up to?" If he can build a space ship that can fly to Earth -- and a robot that can destroy our tanks and guns -- what other terrors can he unleash at will? ...Obviously we must find this monster. We must track him down like a wild animal and destroy him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BARLEY'S HANDS It is a full page layout, in the style of the American Weekly, showing a demented artist's conception of a mass invasion of space ships. Weird-looking creatures are slaughtering Earth people with ray guns. The caption at the top of the image reads: "Are We Long For This World?" (Gabriel Heater's voice continues uninterruptedly over this and the next two scenes.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is reading his paper with considerable interest.

direction.raw_text: The third-page story reads: SAVANT CALLS MEETING TO STUDY SPACE SHIP. Professor Jacob Barnhardt, world-famous scientist and Nobel Prize winner, has invited fellow scientists from all over the world to meet with him in Washington and study the recently landed "Space Ship."

direction.raw_text: His face is thoughtful as he finishes reading. This story seems to impress and interest him. Then suddenly he finds his attention caught at what the Radio Voice is saying.

dialogue.raw_text: But where would such a creature hide himself? Would he disappear into the north woods? Or would he slither off into the sewers of some great city?
