dialogue.raw_text: Where is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Department of Commerce. She's a secretary. (Klaatu nods) They have a man they call the Secretary, but he isn't at all. My mother's a real secretary. (after a moment; eagerly) Mr. Carpenter -- now can we go see the space ship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A crew of Army engineers is in process of erecting a temporary structure such as a large Quonset hut or B29 hanger to enclose the space ship and Gort. The walls are partially up and already have concealed part of the ship. The area is roped off and there are Army guards to keep the sightseers back. There is a crowd of people behind the ropes, watching. CAMERA MOVES IN to reveal the backs of Bobby and Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby is studying the ship and Gort eagerly, his imagination thoroughly aroused. Klaatu is watching the men at work with mild, quiet amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - GORT from Bobby's viewpoint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby's eyes are wide with awe as he watches the giant robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby's attention shifts to the ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, I'll bet he's strong. I bet he could knock down a whole building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a quizzical smile) I shouldn't be at all surprised.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From Bobby's viewpoint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (excitedly, indicating the ship) Gee, I'd like to get inside and see how it works. What do you think makes it go?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly, after a glance around) Well -- atomic power, I would imagine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Klaatu incredulously) I thought that was only for bombs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It's for a lot of other things, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think it can go faster than an F- 36?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes -- I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT KLAATU AND BOBBY shooting from a side angle to include a couple of men who are listening to Klaatu's conversation. They are nudging each other, amused at the way this man is pretending to explain things to the little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu has noticed the two men, who have edged a little closer to listen. He is not perturbed by them, but he lowers his voice a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu interrupts himself as he realizes that he may be going too far. The two men have moved closer, listening and grinning. One of them whispers to the other behind the back of his hand. Then the man realizes that Klaatu has stopped speaking and is looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men burst out laughing and move off together. Bobby, who has missed the point of this by-play, looks at Klaatu, then after the men. As they move out of scene they laugh loudly at the little boy's confusion. Klaatu takes Bobby's hand to lead him away from the roped-off area.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: About a thousand miles an hour?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe four thousand miles an hour. And outside the Earth's atmosphere a good deal faster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excitedly) Gee! How could they make a landing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well -- there are several ways to reduce landing speed. You see, the velocity--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) Keep goin', Mister. He was fallin' for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: them as they move away through the crowd. As they do so, several newsboys are working their way through the crowd with newly arrived extras. The boys are calling out the extras: "Police under fire!" "Army put in charge!" "Space man still at large!" etc. People are eagerly buying the papers. Klaatu and Booby watch this as they pass through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SPACE MAN ELUDES POLICE ARMY PUT IN CHARGE

direction.raw_text: In newsboy's hand. The headline reads: SPACE MAN ELUDES POLICE ARMY PUT IN CHARGE.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CONGRESS ACTS AS POLICE CHIEF REIGNS

direction.raw_text: In another newsboy's hand. This headline reads: DISTRICT UNDER MARTIAL LAW. CONGRESS ACTS AS POLICE CHIEF REIGNS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they move on away from the excited crowd of people. Klaatu's reaction has been one of mild curiosity. Bobby looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This explanation misses Bobby by several light years. He glances up at Klaatu blankly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulled out of his reverie, Klaatu glances down at Bobby and smiles apologetically. Bobby grins back at him. Then, as they walk on a few more steps, Klaatu stops and speaks thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby stares up at him and his face breaks into a broad admiring grin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You think they'll ever find him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (alter a moment's pause) I don't know, Bobby. I'm inclined to doubt it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (as they continue walking) Mr. Carpenter -- what does velocity mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (preoccupied) Velocity is the time rate of change of position.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll bet that's the way Professor Barnhardt talks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bobby -- I have an idea. Let's go see Professor Barnhardt and find out how he talks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a half-smile of accusation) You're just kidding, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wouldn't you like to meet him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, sure I would, but -- (he's to be not going taken in) Aw, I'll bet you'd be scared.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a private smile) We can scare him more than he can scare us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like you, Mr. Carpenter. You're a real screwball.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The house is an unimposing old-fashioned structure, shouldered on either side by similar one-family dwellings. There is a flight of stone steps leading up to the entrance and a large porch across the front of the house. Klaatu and Bobby walk into scene and pause, Klaatu glances at Bobby and Bobby nods toward the house. They move on up the steps to the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHOOSE SHOT - AT FRONT DOOR Bobby, all eagerness and excitement, presses the bell. They wait a moment and there is no answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby wanders down the porch and looks into a window. Fascinated by what he sees, he gestures to Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a glance at the front door, Klaatu joins Bobby at the window and looks in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (disappointed at the thought) Gee -- maybe he isn't home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Betcha this is where he works--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: through the window, over the heads of Klaatu and Bobby. The room is more of a workroom than a study. It is in comfortably shabby disarray, with papers and books everywhere. There's a battered old desk and a day bed. One wall is solid bookshelves and on the other two are blackboards covered with a fantastic array of complex equations, graphs and diagrams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His attention has been caught by one of the blackboards and he studies it with great interest and curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - SECTION OF BLACKBOARD It is covered with a particularly complicated series of equations in a chalky scrawl, involving angles of vector, Keplerian ellipses, etc. The final equations are unsolved; they have no answers after the "equals" sign. Across are little printed signs tacked to the blackboard reading: "Don't erase!" and "Don't touch!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bewildered, Bobby looks from the blackboard up at Klaatu. Still studying the blackboard, Klaatu is shaking his head and clucking his tonsure as one might at the attempts of a child to solve a problem in arithmetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby moves over to a pair of French doors beyond the window and tries to peer in through the curtained doors. He absently tries the doors and finds them locked. Then he turns away with a disappointed but philosophical shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Bobby moves away from the doors dejectedly, Klaatu puts his hand on the knob.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the equations) What does that mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a problem in celestial mechanics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bet he's the only one in the world knows the answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he shakes his head, smiling) He doesn't know the answer. And he'll never get it that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We probably couldn't get to see him even if he was home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He's watching Klaatu and his eyes widen at what he sees.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in complete surprise) Hey -- where you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He has opened the door and is standing in the doorway, his hand, still on the knob. He is smiling at Bobby with secret amusement. He's got an idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu disappears into the study. Amazed, Bobby follows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If he's that difficult to see, perhaps we ought to leave a calling card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bobby watches as Klaatu walks to the blackboard and picks up a piece of chalk. As though correcting a schoolboy's work, he makes large check marks at several points in each equation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An efficient-looking middle-aged woman is mounting the steps to the entrance, getting her front door key out of her purse, when her eye falls on the French doors, which are standing ajar. Puzzled, she starts down the porch toward the doors. This woman is Barnhardt's secretary and her name is HILDA. Bobby is watching as Klaatu writes across the blackboard in a bold hand: Differentiate the equation ( ). Klaatu underlines this comment with a sharp stroke, when a stern voice is heard off screen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu and Bobby turn in surprise. Standing in the open French doors is Hilda, eyeing them with stern suspicion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a polite nod he goes out the French doors, followed by Bobby. Hilda eyes the door for a moment, then glances down at the paper in her hand, disturbed and puzzled by this stranger. Her glance wanders to the blackboard and she picks up an eraser, debating whether to erase Klaatu's corrections. At that moment the French door opens and Klaatu sticks his head in. Startled, Hilda drops the eraser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he disappears, leaving Hilda to glare after him in impotent rage. Deciding that this man is either a crackpot or a menace, she goes to the telephone on the desk and starts dialing a number.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (outraged by Klaatu's desecration of the sacred blackboard) How dare you write on that blackboard! (Klaatu eyes her mildly) Do you realize the Professor has been working on that problem for weeks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleasantly) He'll catch on to it in no time now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (controlling herself with an effort) How did you get in here? And what do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We came to see Professor Barnhardt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, he's not here. And he won't be back till this evening. (sternly) I think you'd better leave now. Unruffled, Klaatu turns to the desk and scribbles something on a scratch pad. He tears off the piece of paper and hands it to Hilda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You might keep this. (with easy assurance) I think the professor will want to get in touch with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to the blackboard) I wouldn't erase that. The Professor needs it very badly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu and Bobby come down the steps and turn into the sidewalk. They are talking and laughing together, but we can't hear their conversation. CAMERA PANS with them as they move on up the sidewalk, revealing two kids playing hopscotch. Klaatu watches, fascinated, as he walks by. Then, having passed the kids, he tries the one-footed, then two-footed hop that characterizes the game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hilda is talking on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --no, Sergeant, there was no classified material around, but I have instructions to report anything unusual to the police... Yes -- I'm Professor Barnhardt's secretary. (consulting the paper in her hand) The man's name is Carpenter -- and he lives at 1615 St. Street, N.W... Yes, that's right--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bobby and Klaatu come out of a wooded path into a section of the cemetery where the myriad crosses seem to reach into infinity. They pause for a moment, then Bobby leads the way through one of the rows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in one of the many rows are crosses that extend beyond CAMERA RANGE. CAMERA MOVES IN on one of the crosses. It bears the name LT. ROBERT BENSON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they come into scene and look down at the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu's glance roves out thoughtfully to the infinite rows of crosses, and his eyes are sad as they return to Bobby.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's my father. (Klaatu glances at the boy, then nods understandingly) He was killed at a place called Anzio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Klaatu and Bobby are approaching a bench beside a pathway overhung with trees. Bobby leads the way to the bench and they sit down. Klaatu's eyes stray out to the myriad crosses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby looks at him, puzzled and impressed by this incomprehensible notion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes are drawn subconsciously out to the rows of crosses. Then he turns back to Klaatu with a slow-dawning look of curiosity, and Klaatu deliberately changes the subject.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a moment Bobby's expression changes and he breaks into a broad grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby gives him a look of amazement, then grins, assuming Klaatu was kidding and simply hasn't any money.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Reflectively) Did all these people die in wars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (somewhat surprised) Sure. Didn't you ever hear of Arlington Cemetery?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- I'm afraid not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very serious) Mr. Carpenter" -- you don't seem to know about anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Amused) I'll tell you, Bobby -- I've been away for a long time. Very far away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it different where you've been? (indicating the cemetery) Don't they have places like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) They have cemeteries. But not like this one... You see, they don't have any wars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gee -- that's a good idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What would you like to do this afternoon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go to the movies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he didn't dare hope for this) No foolin'? Will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Certainly. (then he hesitates) Tell me, Bobby -- do you have to have money to go there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eagerly) I've got some money. My mother gave me two dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- I want to take you to the movies. (he takes some objects out of his pocket) Do you think they'd accept these?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sparkling in his palm are eight or ten cut diamonds of various sizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy is staring at the stones in wide-eyed amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy studies Klaatu's face to see if he's kidding. Realizing that he's not, Bobby's face takes on a childishly shrewd expression -- as though he were about to trade a jackknife for an ocean liner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy takes out two dollar bills and offers them almost challengingly. Klaatu takes the bills and hands Bobby two good-sized Diamonds. They study their new acquisitions with interest. Bobby looks up from his diamonds to steal a guilty glance at Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gee -- those look like diamonds!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some places that's what people use for money. They're easy to carry -- and they don't wear out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at them fascinated) Bet they're worth about a million dollars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you give me your two dollars for a couple of them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a nervous, unsure smile) Well, sure, but--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's not say anything to my mother about this, Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mildly curious) Why not, Bobby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gravely) She doesn't like me to steal from people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shooting toward the curb as a police prowl car drives up and stops in front of the boardinghouse. A Detective in plainclothes gets out and gestures to the uniformed Driver to pull up the street a way and wait. The Driver nods and the car moves off as the Detective crosses the sidewalk to the boardinghouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT As the Detective mounts the steps he glances through a window into the living room. Klaatu can be seen reading to Bobby, who is perched happily on the arm of Klaatu's chair. The Detective moves to the front door ant rings the bell. There is the sound of running feet and in a moment the door is opened and Bobby appears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Carpenter come home yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (studying the man curiously) Yeah -- he's right inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tell him I'd like to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Detective steps inside and Bobby closes the door, as Klaatu appears from the living room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling out) Mr. Carpenter--! (to the Detective) Come on in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your name Carpenter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled that anyone should know him) Yes. (then recalling, with a smile of satisfaction) Oh -- I suppose Professor Barnhardt's looking far me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dryly, with grim emphasis) I been looking for you all afternoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An inexpensive convertible -- a 1948 Ford, or Chevrolet -- drives up and stops in front of the house. Helen and Tom are in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get the feeling that Helen and Ton have spent a very enjoyable day together and are reluctant to say goodnight. Tom puts his arm around her and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a smile and, a quick kiss, Helen gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (fondly) It was a wonderful day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You still haven't answered my question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (warmly sincere) You know how I feel, Tom. I just want to think it over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The boss is leaving for Chicago tomorrow. If I could tell him I was getting married -- with two dependents--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) You're a good salesman -- but I've got to think about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A good insurance salesman wouldn't give you time to think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Helen turns and hurries across the sidewalk to the house. In the entrance she turns and waves to Tom. He waves back and drives off slowly. Helen lets herself in with her key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Detective is putting on his hat and preparing to leave with Klaatu as Helen enters. There is a moment of awkwardness and confusion as she glances, puzzled, at the Detective. Bobby runs to her and greets her excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu is uneasy but tries not to show it as he smiles in greeting and introduces the Detective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen glances quickly at the Detective, then at Klaatu, surprised and troubled. She turns to Bobby to cover her confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Klaatu nods and prepares to follow him, Bobby speaks to Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu and the Detective nod to Helen and they go out. Helen watches the door close with real concern, wondering why the police want Klaatu and hoping he hasn't done anything wrong. Still disturbed, she turns to lead Bobby upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This satisfies him for the moment -- even though it doesn't satisfy Helen. He is climbing the stairs beside her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi Mom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, darling. (she kisses Bobby, then turns questioningly to Klaatu and the Detective) Good evening, Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Benson -- this is Mr. Brady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Impressively) Mr. Brady's a cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bobby) Did you have a nice day, dear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (enthusiastically) Boy, we had a swell time. Didn't we, Mr. Carpenter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We certainly did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We went to the movies -- and we had ice cream cones -- and we went to see Daddy--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moved and grateful, she's uneasy and concerned as she turns to Klaatu) I don't know how to thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I enjoyed every minute of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with quiet insistence) We better get goin', Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, gee -- we didn't finish our story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll finish it tomorrow... Goodnight, Bobby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly) Goodnight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Bobby. Time to go to bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he followers her, then hesitates) Mom -- why does Mr. Carpenter have to go down to the police station?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, dear... Perhaps there's some mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We sure had fun today. We saw the space ship and we went to see Professor Barnhardt -- and--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flashing him a puzzled, incredulous look) Professor Barnhardt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost ignoring the interruption) Yeah, sure. Mom, do I have to go to school tomorrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, gee, Mom -- I had plans to play with Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The place is crowded and there is a feeling of feverish but well-ordered activity. Unidentified people who have been picked up in the search for the space man are being screened by the police. They are all men -- all between forty and sixty years old -- and they are from all walks of life. A series of desks have been arranged in a row, with signs over them reading IDENTIFICATION. At each desk is a team of cops and before each desk is a line of men waiting to be screened. At the far end of the room Klaatu can be seen at the desk of a Police Lieutenant, with the detective who picked him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Shooting over the shoulders of two cops at one of the desks, toward the line of people they are screening. A nondescript, middle-aged vagrant stands before the desk as one of the cops flips through a card file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man is taken out of the line as CAMERA MOVES ON to the next desk, with another pair of cops and another line. A rather distinguished-looking business man is placing a sheaf of identification cards and papers on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the cops at the desk glances over the papers and nods to the man.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the cop beside him) B.M. Alberts -- no prior arrests.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the vagrant) No identification? (the man shakes his head dully) Send him over to G-2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife just arrived with my identification.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That'll be all, Mr. Baxter. Sorry to bother you... Next.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to a third desk where a small, rat-faced man is standing uneasily before the two cops, one of whom is flipping through a card file.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cappo, John C? (the man nods) Two priors -- one for petty theft -- one for shoplifting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (waving the man away) Okay, Jonny -- you can go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a nervous grin) Sometimes a record comes in handy. (and he moves off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - AT LIEUTENANT'S DESK A Detective Lieutenant in plain clothes is questioning Klaatu, who stands beside the Detective who brought him in. The Lieutenant is a rugged but dignified man about fifty, intelligent and businesslike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant exchanges a look with the Detective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lieutenant shifts in his chair, annoyed that he has to deal with this madman. He glances at a report on his desk, trying to control his impatience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant is turning away in exasperation as a uniformed cop comes into the scene.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Professor's secretary says she found you in Barnhardt's room, making marks on his blackboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was only trying to be helpful. He was having difficulty with a problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sardonically) Oh, I see. He was having trouble and you were helping him out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pleasantly) That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly sharp and accusing) I suppose you know that Barnhardt does a lot of secret work for the Army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In this case the secret wouldn't be worth much. He doesn't know the answer himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (growing impatient) But I suppose you know the answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a deprecating shrug) It's really quite simple... The three- body problem, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your name's Carpenter -- that right? (Klaatu nods) Any identification, Mr. Carpenter? Driver's license -- social security number?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- I'm afraid not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, how do I know who you are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (secretly amused) You don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me, Lieutenant -- (pointing offscene) The Doc says this man needs treatment right away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A man about forty-five, bloodied and badly beaten, is being supported and half-carried by two policemen. A police doctor is guiding them to a doorway, near which is a sign INFIRMARY. The man is almost unconscious, incapable even of holding up his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - AT LIEUTENANT'S DESK LIEUTENANT What's the story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant grimaces his disgust and impatience with mob violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really concerned now, Klaatu tries to find a way out. He attempts an authoritative air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shaking off the Detective's hand, Klaatu speaks to the Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Detective takes Klaatu's arm and leads him toward the door. As they go they pass a Military Police Captain, who makes his way straight to the Lieutenant's desk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Some fella caught him lookin' in a window and figured he was the space man. The whole neighborhood went crazy and they ganged up on him. Would have killed him if we hadn't come along... Turns out he was just a prowler.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay -- book him and get him fixed up. (the cops nods and goes, and the Lieutenant growls as he turns back to Klaatu and the Detective) Looks like everybody's goin' nuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (appalled by what he has seen and heard) They would have killed this man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gruffly) People get hysterical enough, they do anything. (impatiently) Look, Mr. Carpenter -- if you can't identify yourself, I got to send you over to the Army.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pretending impatience, but actually growing concerned) How long will that take?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They can tell right away. They've got a couple of doctors who saw this man in the hospital. (to the Detective) Take him over to G2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's very important, Lieutenant, that I see Professor Barnhardt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Mr. Carpenter--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I suggest that you call the Professor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (all patience gone) Get going, will you, Brady -- before I get mad!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as they come out of the station. Klaatu hesitates a moment, looks around. His face reveals nothing, but he seems to be momentarily considering the idea of making a break. The Detective, sensitive to such a possibility, hooks his arm under Klaatu's and nods his head toward the sidewalk in silent command. Klaatu allows himself to be led off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the Detective leads Klaatu across the sidewalk to the curb, where a police car is standing. Parked just behind it is an Army staff car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - ENTRANCE TO POLICE STATION as the M.P. Captain appears in the entrance, accompanied by the Police Lieutenant. They see Klaatu and the Detective approaching the police car and hurry out of scene after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - AT POLICE CAR LIEUTENANT (to the Detective) Wait a minute, Brady-- (indicating orders in his hand) The Captain here's got orders from General Cutler to take this man over to Professor Barnhardt. M.P. CAPTAIN (to Klaatu firmly but respectfully) Will you come with me, Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu gets out of the police car and the Captain escorts him toward the staff car. Passing the Lieutenant, Klaatu speaks with a polite smile, a smile that might be one of mild triumph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lieutenant reacts with impatient exasperation as the Captain holds the staff car door open for Klaatu, who steps into the Army vehicle, as we--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry to trouble you, Lieutenant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the M.P. Captain and Klaatu enter the front door, which is held open for then by Hilda. She gestures them toward the half-open door of Barnhardt's study, where Barnhardt can be seen puzzling over the problem on the blackboard. The Captain knocks on the open door to attract his attention and enters with Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt turns from his deep preoccupation at the blackboard, chalk in hand. M.P. CAPTAIN This is the man you wanted to see, Professor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps out into the hall, closing the door. Barnhardt continues to study Klaatu for a moment, then points to the notations he made on the blackboard. There is a controlled but anxious excitement in Barnhardt's attitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu glances at the work Barnhardt has been doing on the board. Then he points to one of the expressions in an equation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impressed and interested, Barnhardt tugs at his chin as he studies and weighs the results.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt hesitates for a long, thoughtful moment. Then he goes to the door, opens it and speaks to the Captain outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt closes the door and turns to find Klaatu watching him with a faint smile. Barnhardt sinks into a chair, trying to adjust his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt is forced reluctantly to accept Klaatu's refusal to go any further. After a moment's thought, he speaks seriously, but with a twinkle in his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt stands staring at him for a moment, passes his hand across his brow. Then, as Klaatu watches, Barnhardt paces the floor, trying to digest what he has heard. After a moment, he turns to Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt flings him a glance, then looks momentarily sheepish. But his own eagerness carries him on. He paces the floor thoughtfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The implications of this statement leave Barnhardt speechless, his keen mind reeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt stands silent for a moment, trying to collect his shattered thoughts. Klaatu watches him as he starts pacing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu's bland manner leaves Barnhardt shaken, almost wishing he'd never started this business.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (studying Klaatu curiously) Thank you, Captain. M.P. CAPTAIN I'll wait outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wrote this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding easily) It was a clumsy way to introduce myself -- but I understand you're a difficult man to see. (glancing at the blackboard reproachfully) I thought you'd have the solution by this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet. That's why I wanted to see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All you have to do now is substitute this expression-- (pointing to a specific place) --at this point.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly, thoughtfully) Yes -- that will reproduce the first- order terms. But what about the effect of the other terms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Almost negligible... With variation of parameters, this is the answer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can you be so sure? Have you tested this theory?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a slight smile) I find it works well enough to get me from one planet to another. (Barnhardt stares at him blankly) I understand you've called a meeting to study our space ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As though unsure of what he's heard) Yes -- yes, I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Klaatu. (noting that Barnhardt's expression is changing from amazement to incredulity) I spent two days at your Walter Reed Hospital. Room 309. My doctor's name was Major White -- and I had a very attractive nurse called Ruth, who's getting married next Wednesday. (Klaatu waits for this to sink in, then speaks with quiet authority) If you are not interested -- or if you intend to turn me over to your Army -- we needn't waste any more time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the Captain, his voice a little unsteady) You can go now, Captain. Please thank General Cutler and tell him -- tell him that I know this gentleman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dryly) You have faith, Professor Barnhardt
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't faith that makes good science, Mr. Klaatu. Its curiosity. (unable to conceal his interest) Sit down, please. I have several thousand questions to ask you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring the invitation) I would like to explain something of my mission here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was my first question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with some bitterness) It was my intention to discuss this officially -- with all the nations of the Earth -- but I was not allowed the Opportunity. I have come to realize since that your mutual fears and suspicions are merely the normal reactions of a primitive society. (gathering his thoughts) We know from scientific observation that you have discovered a rudimentary kind of atomic energy. We also know that you are experimenting with rockets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes -- that is true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the hands of a mature civilization, these would not be considered weapons of aggression. But in the hands of your people-- (he shrugs and shakes his head) We've observed your aggressive tendencies, and we don't trust you with such power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) If you mean that you are afraid of us--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with cool impressive emphasis) We want to be sure you don't make -- let us say -- an unfortunate mistake. We know the potentiality of these developments and we are disturbed to find them in the hands of children... You see, we've had atomic energy for five thousand of your years. (indicating the telephone) We discarded instruments like this many centuries ago. (he paces thoughtfully) So long as you were limited to fighting among yourselves -- with your primitive tanks and planes -- we were unconcerned. But soon you will apply atomic energy to space ships -- and then you become a threat to the peace and security of other planets. That, of course, we cannot tolerate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtful and impressed) These other planets -- do they have peace and security?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We had our atomic wars -- thousands of years ago. (he smiles wryly) After that we fought with bows and arrows. Then, slowly, we learned that fighting is no solution -- that aggression leads to chaos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with deep conviction) We scientists understand this. Even we primitive scientists. (Straightforwardly) What exactly is the nature of your mission, Mr. Klaatu?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I came here to warn you that, by threatening danger, your planet faces danger -- very grave danger. I am prepared, however, to offer a solution.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you care to be more specific?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly) What I have to say must be said to all concerned. (with a suggestion of deference to Barnhardt) It is too important to be entrusted to any individual.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I gather that your efforts on the official level were not entirely successful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sternly, as this unpleasant episode is recalled) I come to you as a last resort -- and I confess that my patience is wearing thin. (with Jovian annoyance) Must I take drastic action in order to get a hearing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uneasily) What -- what sort of action do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Violent action -- since that seems to be the only thing you people understand. (quietly) Leveling the island of Manhattan, perhaps -- or dropping the Rock of Gibraltar into the sea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you be willing to meet with the group of scientists I am calling together?. Perhaps you could explain your mission to them, and they in turn could present it to their various peoples.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly, evenly) That's what I came to see you about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is not enough to have men of science. We scientists are too easily ignored -- or misunderstood. We must get important men from every field. Educators -- philosophers -- church leaders -- men of vision and imagination -- the finest minds in the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I leave that in your hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd have no objection to revealing yourself at this meeting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- not at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about your personal safety in the meantime? What about the Army -- and the police?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Carpenter and I'm a very earthy character living in a respectable boarding house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling, but a little concerned) I'm afraid I can't offer you any real protection. I have no influence in cases of inter-planetary conspiracy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure I'll be quite safe until the meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he suddenly pauses, thoughtfully) One thing, Mr. Klaatu. Suppose this group should reject your proposals. What is the alternative?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a sense of quiet, inescapable power) I'm afraid you have no alternative. In such, a case the planet Earth would have to be-- (he looks for the right word) --eliminated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Such power exists?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I assure you such power exists.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The people who came to the meeting must be made to realize this. They must understand what is at stake. (after a thoughtful moment, he looks up) You mentioned a demonstration of force--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would such, a demonstration be possible before the meeting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes -- of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something that would dramatize for them and for their people the seriousness of the situation. Something that would affect the entire planet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a nod) That can easily be arranged.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frightened by his easy assumption of infinite power) I wouldn't want you to harm anybody -- or destroy anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (easily) Why don't you leave it to me? I'll think of something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a nervous half- smile) Maybe a little demonstration.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinking about it) Something dramatic -- but not destructive. (intellectually amused) It's quite an interesting problem. (Barnhardt nods vaguely) Would day after tomorrow be all right? Say about noon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is about 3:30 the following evening. Helen is sitting in a chair leafing through a magazine. She is dressed to go out. A corner of the dining room can be seen, where Mr. and Mrs. Barley are playing cards with Mr. Krull. Mrs. Crockett, the landlady, enters from the hall on her way to the dining room and notices Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to go on into the dining room and as she does so almost bumps into Klaatu who is coming out, having been kibitzing the card game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu steps aside as she hurries nervously into the dining room. He turns, puzzled, to find Helen watching with a slight smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen watches him, a little uneasy in his presence. She is fond of him, and she can't help being curious and concerned about his brush with the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is deeply moved by Klaatu's affection for the boy, She tried to dismiss her curiosity about him, but she can't. She decides to face it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen has reacted in puzzlement at this second mention of Barnhardt. They are interrupted by the ringing of the doorbell. Helen goes to answer it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . CROCKETT Going out, dear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I'm waiting for Tom to pick me up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CROCKETT (with a shudder) Personally, I won't go out after dark these days. (with an attempt at slyness) But then -- I'm not courting, am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . CROCKETT (thoroughly startled) Oh -- Mr. Carpenter--!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everyone seems so-- (he shakes his hands to indicate nervousness)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jittery is the word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a contemplative smile) Bobby's the only person I know who isn't -- Jittery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has his homework to keep him occupied.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (fondly, sincerely) He's a fine boy, Mrs. Benson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naturally I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Warm and friendly and intelligent-- (thoughtfully) You know -- he's the only real friend I've made since I've been here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitantly and with some difficulty) Mr. Carpenter -- this is none of my business, but -- why did that detective come here last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with easy frankness) Oh -- they just wanted to ask me a few questions. Bobby and I tried to see Professor Barnhardt in the afternoon, but he wasn't in. Apparently they thought I was looking for secrets of some kind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Helen opens the front door to admit Tom. He appears impatient, anxious to get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen tries to shush him, to indicate Klaatu is in the next room, when Klaatu appears in the doorway. He must have heard Tom's remark, and there is an awkward moment. Klaatu is completely unperturbed, but Helen is embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu stops and turns to face them pleasantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes on up the stairs. Helen steers Tom toward the living room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will be in just a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a little annoyed that she hasn't her coat on, he consults his watch) The picture starts at eight-fifty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in explanation) I was talking to Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lightly, but with real sarcasm underneath) I hope Mr. Carpenter won't think I'm intruding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me. I was just going up to my room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (guiltily) Goodnight, Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a good time -- both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you wait in here while I get my things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As they enter from the hall, Helen turns to Tom reproachfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This touches on Helen's own private doubts, and she cannot answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns quickly and goes into the hall and hurries up the stairs. Tom looks after her, dismissing the matter with a shake of the head and a philosophical sigh. Of such stuff are women made.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Oh, Tom, that was awful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (momentary apologetic) I'm sorry. I guess I'm just tired of hearing about Mr. Carpenter. (Helen shushes him) I don't like the way he's attached himself to you and Bobby. After all, what do you know about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll go get my things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - UPSTAIRS HALLWAY Helen reaches the top of the stairs, crosses to her room and grabs a coat off the bed. She's putting it on as she moves down the hall to Bobby's room, the door of which is open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby is at a table doing his homework and Klaatu has just finished explaining an arithmetic problem to him, as Helen enters, still putting on her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is embarrassed. She would like to apologize for the awkwardness downstairs but she doesn't quite know how to go about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and goes out, closing the door. A little distracted, Helen turns to Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen watches as he starts to put away his work. She wants to tell him something, but finds it difficult to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is surprised to get this corroboration for Klaatu's story. Sensing his mother's uneasiness, the boy looks for something intriguing -- some deep, dark secret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a reassuring smile, she starts for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not wanting to go into this any further, Helen blows him a kiss and backs out, closing the door. Bobby stands thinking for a moment, his mind still speculating on all sorts of wonderful possibilities. Still preoccupied, he drifts over to his bed and sits down to take of his shoes. He drops the first one to the floor and is starting on the other, when there is a light rap on his door. The door opens and Klaatu appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby hands him the light, studying his face with eager curiosity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu goes out, closing the door behind him. Bobby hesitates a moment, puzzled and curious. Then he goes over to the door, flips off the lights, and slowly, noiselessly opens the door a crack so he can peer out into the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (about to leave) All you have to remember is, first find the common denominator -- then subtract.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Helen, pleasantly) I'll say goodnight again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Carpenter, I-- (it's too complicated; she can't do it) Goodnight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a warm smile of complete understanding and appreciation) Goodnight, my dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go to bed, darling. You can finish that in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitantly, almost guiltily) Bobby -- I think it would be better if we didn't see quite so much of Mr. Carpenter
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked, and bewildered) Gee, why, Mom? He's my best friend... And he's awful good in arithmetic. He even helps Professor Barnhardt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you and Mr. Carpenter really go to see Professor Barnhardt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure we did! He wasn't there but we went to see him. And Mr. Carpenter showed him how to do his arithmetic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrewdly) Mom -- is there something wrong with Mr. Carpenter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, dear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean -- on account of that policeman last night. (his eyes light up hopefully) You think he's a bank robber, maybe? Or a gangster?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, dear, of course not. He's a very nice man. I Just think he might prefer to be left alone. Now you get to bed and forget about it. (she kisses him) 'Night, darling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodnight. (stopping her in the doorway, his imaginative suspicions mounting) Hey Mom -- why would he want to be alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bobby -- have you a flashlight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised by his appearance and his request) Yeah -- sure. (he goes to a drawer and gets a large hand flashlight) It's a real Boy Scout flashlight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want it for, Mr. Carpenter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evasively) Why -- the light in my room went out. (cutting off further questions) Thank you, Bobby. Goodnight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shooting down the hall through the crack in Bobby's door. Klaatu's door is ajar and through it the lights in his room can be seen burning brightly. Klaatu goes to his door, reaches in and flips off the lights and closes the door. He then scans the hall in both directions. Satisfied he isn't seen, he moves surreptitiously down the hall toward the stairs, still carrying the flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he closes his door carefully, an expression of intense excitement on his face. What he has seem is certainly, unmistakably suspicious. Why did Mr. Carpenter lie to him? What does he want the flashlight for and where is he going? Bobby decides he's got to find out. Hurriedly he laces on the shoe he had taken off, and peers out the door to find the hall clear. He slips out the door, closing it behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - NIGHT Klaatu is walking down the dark, semi-deserted street with the determined stride of a man with a definite objective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - BOBBY Half a block behind, he's following Klaatu, eagerly, flushed with a sense of excitement and adventure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walking along the sidewalk, Klaatu turns into a side street, disappearing from view around the corner. In a moment, Bobby hurries into scene breathlessly. He pulls up for a moment to rest. Then, getting his breath, he dashes on around the corner after Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a temporary structure that has been erected to enclose the space ship and Gort. In front of the one small door are two soldiers, standing guard. Concealed in some foreground foliage, studying the layout, is Klaatu. Nearby 's a sign reading: KEEP OUT! This area OFF LIMITS to the public. U.S. ARMY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a short distance away, watching Klaatu eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he studies the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting over Klaatu's shoulder. As he watches, a Jeep filled with armed soldiers -- apparently regular patrol -- drives up to the entrance of the building. They stop for a moment while their Sergeant checks with the guards. Assured that everything is under control, the Sergeant signals his driver and the Jeep moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU Scanning the side of the building, he sees what he's looking for. Waiting until the Jeep disappears, he starts toward one side of the building, keeping himself concealed in the foliage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puzzled and interested, as he watches Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT The two sentries standing in front of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu maneuvers around the side of the building, where there is a window. It has no glass in it but is heavily barred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU as he leaves the concealing foliage and crosses the clear, grassy area surrounding the building. He stops and tries to see through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting through the barred window into the building. The huge robot looms large and eerie in the shadows cast by a couple of naked work-lights. His head is angled, away from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT as Klaatu approaches the window. Aiming his flashlight at Gort, he flashes the light intermittently, as though signaling. (This should not approximate any known code.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: making his way behind the foliage toward the front of the building. Arriving at a point opposite the entrance, Klaatu waits and watches.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - ENTRANCE TO BUILDING The two guards are standing in the doorway in positions of relaxed alertness. Suddenly, inside the building behind them, the giant figure of Gort looms silently in the doorway. His two great arms reach out, grab the two guards and drag then back inside the building.

direction.raw_text: He lets out an inaudible gasp as he sees this. Bug-eyed, he glances quickly to the point where he last saw Klaatu. He is amazed at what he sees.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT as Bobby approaches the door, fearful but fascinated. He peers cautiously inside and his eyes grow wide as saucers.

direction.raw_text: In *f.g., near the door, the two guards lie unconscious. As Klaatu walks toward the ship Gort slowly turns his head to follow him with him with eyes. Klaatu touches a point on the unbroken surface of the ship and the ramp silently swings out and down to the ground. Klaatu mounts the ramp and disappears inside the ship, whereupon the ramp silently closes.

direction.raw_text: as he watches this; his eyes bulging. He can scarcely believe what he has seen. Suddenly a wave of sheer terror sweeps over him. Scrambling to his feet, he turns and runs wildly away.

direction.raw_text: Klaatu as he moves down the tiny, dimly lighted entrance corridor. He steps into the main cabin of the ship and flips a switch which bathes the cabin in a diffused, shadowless light. The walls are lined with a complex of mysterious gadgetry -- knobs, dials, indicators, etc. All of this should be as imaginative and unorthodox as possible, while still retaining a feeling of sound but highly advanced engineering.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT as Klaatu moves to the communications panel, flipping switches and turning dials. Indicators light up. There are crackling, whirring and buzzing sounds. Klaatu starts speaking into a built-in microphone in his own strange language. He speaks in rapid-fire explanation, continuing to talk, as we--

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM BOARDINGHOUSE NIGHT Bobby is curled up in a chair waiting for his mother to come home. He's sleepy, but the excitement of what he has seen precluded any such possibility. From the hall we hear the front door opening as Helen and Tom come in.

dialogue.raw_text: (patiently disbelieving) Now, Bobby, just a minute--

dialogue.raw_text: Honest, Mom, I saw him. It just opened up and he walked right in. And that great big iron man was moving around!

dialogue.raw_text: That robot fella grabbed 'em and dragged 'em inside! (his lips trembling) I like Mr. Carpenter -- but I'm scared, Mom.

dialogue.raw_text: (holding him close to her sympathetically) Mustn't be frightened, darling -- It was just a bad dream. Here -- we'll prove it to you. (with a look and a nod to Tom) Tom, will you ask Mr. Carpenter if he'll come down for a minute. (Tom turns to go) The room right opposite mine.

dialogue.raw_text: Now think back hard. You didn't follow Mr. Carpenter at all, did you? You haven't even been out of the house.

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Tom is knocking softly at Klaatu's door. Getting no answer, he tries the door, pushes it open and peers in. Then he steps into the darkened room.

He stoops down and picks up a fair-sized diamond. Tom studies the stone curiously, holding it up to the light. Thoroughly puzzled, he keeps the stone in his hand, switches off the light and goes out.

direction.raw_text: As the impact of this sinks in, Helen and Tom turn to stare at each other in questioning consternation.

dialogue.raw_text: (seriously concerned) You think it's all right for you to stay here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, boy -- can I, Mom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, dear. Come on now. (she happens to look down at his feet. Puzzled, and concerned, she feels his shoes) Bobby, your shoes are soaking!

dialogue.raw_text: (reluctantly, with childish guilt) Yeah -- the grass was kind of wet.

direction.raw_text: . OF COMMERCE BLDG. - MED. CLOSE SHOT DAY It is a typical government office, with lots of desks in it. Helen is at her desk, straightening it up to go to lunch. This done, she moves briskly to get her coat. CAMERA PANS to follow her and suddenly, startlingly reveals Klaatu standing near the clothes rack, as though he had materialized out of thin air. Helen is thoroughly startled.

dialogue.raw_text: May I see you for a minute?

direction.raw_text: As Helen presses the first floor button, the doors close and the elevator starts down. She turns to face Klaatu.

direction.raw_text: Without warning the elevator comes to a jolting, jarring stop as the power is cut off and the lights go out. The car is illuminated faintly and eerily by light that seeps through the ventilating grills from a skylight in the shaft. Helen is terrified.

direction.raw_text: Helen fumbles to get her wrist watch into a faint beam of light.

dialogue.raw_text: (a moment's hesitation; then he remembers) What time is it?

direction.raw_text: All vehicular traffic in the street is at a dead stop. Automobiles, busses, trolley cars -- all are stalled. Drivers and passengers are climbing out of the vehicles in utter bewilderment. Except for the people, it is as though the street had been frozen in motion.

direction.raw_text: A huge automobile or airplane assembly line, with nothing moving, no machinery going.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People carne pouring up the stairs wildly, feverishly anxious to escape the darkness below. Their eyes blink weakly in the unaccustomed sunlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars, taxis and busses are stalled, their frenzied drivers unable to figure out what's happened. A junk peddler with a broken-down horse and wagon moves grandly and leisurely through the stalled vehicles. The peddler bears a happy grin of superiority. This is his moment of triumph over modern civilization.

At the moment she`s beside herself with excitement. Barnhardt watches her with a half-smile of secret amusement. He has already deduced the cause of what's happening.

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir -- it certainly does!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding with a bland little smile) That's good, Hilda. I'm glad.

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Seated at a conference table are high-ranking officers of the Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps. There is the uneasy tension of people dealing with unknown forces. An Army Major General, who's Chairman of the meeting, is speaking.

direction.raw_text: Ryder is a Colonel of engineers, a man about forty-five.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --as far as we can tell, all power's been cut off everywhere -- with a few exceptions: hospitals, planes in flight -- that sort of thing. I wish I could be more specific but, as you now, all communications are out telephone, radio, cable -- everything. (gravely) I can tell you that the President is prepared to declare a state of national emergency. (pausing to let this sink in) Before we start discussing plans, I want a report from Colonel Ryder. What about the robot, Colonel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When it was discovered last night that the robot had moved, I was directed by the Joint Chiefs to find a means of immobilizing him. We accomplished that this morning by encasing him in a block of KL 93. (he hands a small block of plastic to the General) It's a new plastic material -- stronger than steel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it possible that he's broken out of this stuff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir. I've Just checked on that. He's locked up tight as a drum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right -- that means we concentrate on the man. (to the group with force and authority) Up till now we've agreed on the desirability of capturing this man alive. We can no longer afford to be so particular. We'll get him alive, if possible -- but we must get him! (eyes the group sternly) Is that clear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - TOM AND JEWELER The shop and its glittering display cases, which were brilliantly lighted in the previous scene, are now gloomy and dim. All artificial light is off. The Jeweler is a bright- eyed old man of seventy with a middle European accent. He is completely fascinated as he examines the diamond Tom has given him, and is annoyed by the lack of light. He speaks impatiently to one of the girls in the shop who happens to pass by.

direction.raw_text: In the dim light of the stalled elevator, Klaatu is finishing explaining to Helen the story of his mission. Overwhelmed by the staggering import of what he has told her, Helen is listening with great interest and concern.

direction.raw_text: Helen is staring at him in awe, but also in complete admiration and sympathy.

direction.raw_text: Klaatu smiles at her warmly and she manages to return the smile. Their relationship is further cemented by the sharing of this vital secret.

direction.raw_text: Suddenly and without warning, the elevator starts moving and the lights go on. Startled, Helen looks at him.

dialogue.raw_text: (speaking gravely) --I've already told you more than I told Professor Barnhardt, because my life, in a sense, is in your hands. I thought if you knew the facts you'd appreciate the importance of my not being -- apprehended, -- before the meeting tonight.

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, of course. Of course I do.

dialogue.raw_text: (studying his face anxiously) You hold great hope for this meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can see no other hope for your planet. If the meeting should fail, then I'm afraid there is no hope.

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) It must be twelve-thirty.

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at her watch, then back at him, awe-struck) Yes -- Just exactly.
