dialogue.raw_text: Attention, please.... All flights from National Airport have been canceled until further notice.. All flights from this airport have been canceled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: AT TRAIN GATE - DAY M.P.'s are blocking the gates leading to trains and ticket takers are busy explaining matters and remonstrating with irate ticket holders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Passengers are being herded off a loaded bus that was preparing to leave the depot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Army has thrown a roadblock across a main highway on the outskirts of the city and is permitting no one to leave. From the line of halted cars we see and the insistent honking of horns we hear, we get the impression of hundreds of cars stacked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is 6:00 P.M. and growing dark outside, but the lights are not on. The office is small and unpretentious, the business habitat of a man who works in a big insurance agency. Tom's secretary is on the phone, reflecting the world-wide terror of the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The corridor door opens and Tom enters with an air of urgency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The secretary has a reaction of surprise, but she manages to stop Tom at his door. He has flipped on the lights in passing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom disappears into his office, closing the door. The secretary is getting out a telephone directory when the corridor door opens and Helen enters, tense and nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The secretary buzzes the intercom and speaks into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is starting for the door when it opens and Tom appears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone, nervous and jittery) --Honest, Mary, I'm so scared I can't sit still. I'd like to run some place, but I don't know where to go-- (hearing the door open, she cuts off) 'Bye now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call the Pentagon and find out who's in charge of this space man business. Whoever it is I want to talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Benson's been trying to get you all afternoon. She says it's important.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get this other call first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Mrs. Benson -- He just walked in. (misery loves company) Are you nervous, too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I am, Margaret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Benson is here. (turning to Helen) Go on in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tom -- I've been trying to get you all afternoon--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (preoccupied with his own excitement) Come on in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Tom follows Helen inside and closes the door. He turns to her, his voice tense with excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are interrupted by the sharp sound of the interoffice buzzer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom picks up the phone and answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Realizing what he's doing, Helen crosses to him, pleading wildly, desperately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is as though he had slapped her across the face. Suddenly he has revealed himself, naked and distasteful. Feeling guilty as he sees the contempt and revulsion in her eyes, he tries the old charm, holding his hand over the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and runs quickly out of the room. Tom's inclination is to follow her, when his connection is completed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've got some terrific news about your friend, Mr. Carpenter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to appear calm) What about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helen, he's the man from the space ship! (she eyes him evenly, apprehensively, as he hurries on) I had that diamond checked at three different places. Nobody on earth's ever seen a stone like that! After what Bobby told us, that's enough for me. Why is it nobody knows anything about him? Why hasn't he got any money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (evenly, with quiet tension) All right, Tom -- it's true. I know it's true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind about that. (urgently, with great concern) You've got to promise me you won't say a word to anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you crazy? After what happened today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't understand. You don't realize how important it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impatiently) Important? Of course it's important. The point is we can do something about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I'm trying to tell you. We mustn't do anything about it. Believe me, Tom, I know what I'm talking about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (irritated by her opposition) He's a menace to the whole world! It's our duty to turn him in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (desperately) But he isn't a menace! He told me what he came here for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dismissing this with annoyed contempt) He told you... Don't be silly, honey -- just because you like the guy. (busy with his own thoughts) You realize what this'd mean for us? I'd be the biggest man in the country. I could write my own ticket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing him coldly) Is that what you're thinking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (guiltily, defensive) Why not? Somebody's got to get rid of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going to let you do it, Tom. (with deep personal urgency) Believe me, this is literally the most important thing in the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Yes?... What's his name, Margaret? General Cutler? (disappointed that the connection isn't completed) All right, I'll hold on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tom, you mustn't -- ! You don't know what you're doing! It isn't just you and Mr. Carpenter. The rest of the world, is involved!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exasperated) I don't care about the rest of the world!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll feel different when you see my picture in the papers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at him starkly) I feel different right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uneasily) You wait and see. You're going to marry a big hero!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going to marry anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Hello, General Cutler? (irritated) No, I don't want to speak to his aide. I want to speak to the General. Tell him it's about the space man... My name is Tom Stevens. S-t-e-v-e-n- s.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Helen hurries out of the building, hails a cab, gets into it and the cab drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom now has General Cutler on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) That's right, General. That's where he's staying... Yes, of course I'm sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . The General is on the phone and is making notes. There are a couple of officers standing near his desk, a Colonel and a Lieutenant Colonel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel nods and starts out of the room, as we--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (after listening for a moment) Thank you very much, Mr. Stevens. I'll want to talk to you further but I haven't time now. (hangs up and turns to Colonel) Deploy all Zone 5 units according to Plan B -- immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - HELEN - NIGHT The cab is traveling through city traffic. Nervous and edgy, Helen glances at her watch impatiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A jeep filled with armed soldiers is moving down the street at a fast clip. Behind the jeep is an Army staff car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE- SHOT - STAFF CAR shooting from outside into the car. In the front seat beside the driver is a full Colonel, wearing helmet and side-arms. The car is moving swiftly through traffic as the Colonel speaks into the transmitter of a radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - COMMAND AND RECONNAISSANCE CAR It is filled with soldiers wearing helmets and carrying rifles and Tommy guns. It is traveling quite fast. A soldier with a handy-talkie transmits an order to the driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - STREET The C. and R. car is seen to be at the head of a convoy of eight Army vehicles which are moving swiftly down the street. The trucks are filled with armed soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - ANOTHER STREET On this street also an armed convoy is racing by, headed by a Jeep mounting a .30 caliber machine gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - ANOTHER STREET On this street also a convoy rolls by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen's cab rounds the corner into the boardinghouse street. CAMERA PANS with cab as it draws up in front of the boardinghouse. The cab waits as Helen jumps out and runs up the steps to the front door. A couple of children are playing jump-rope in the light of a street lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOVING - STAFF CAR - MED. CLOSE SHOT shooting in at the Colonel as he issues an order into the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the rear of the convoy as it races down a main thoroughfare. As the convoy reaches each intersection, the last vehicle peels off the column and, turns into the side street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANOTHER CONVOY racing down another street, the rear vehicles peeling off at the intersections as in previous scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Following one of the vehicles after it has peeled off into a side street. It turns around in the side street and draws up facing the intersection, its motor still running. We get the impression of a methodical plan to block off each street.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu and Helen come hurrying down the steps and pile into the waiting taxi. The kids playing Jump-rope stop and watch as the door is closed and the cab pulls out, disappearing as it makes a right turn at the end of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (This is opposite end of street from last shot.) Barreling across the intersection into the boardinghouse street is the jeep followed by the Colonel's staff car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the Jeep and staff car pull up in front of the boarding house, the soldiers in the jeep pile out and cover the entrance to the house. Meanwhile the Colonel, still in the staff car, is talking to the two kids playing out front. They chatter excitedly, pointing in the direction taken by the cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He speaks into his radio in tones of clipped and quiet efficiency. The car remains standing at the curb.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... Yellow cab, moving north on B from Ninth Street. Man and woman in back seat. Get the license number and report.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cab 's moving through traffic at a normal speed. Klaatu and Helen are tense and nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cab's moving through traffic at a normal speed. Klaatu and Helen are tense and nervous.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure Barnhardt can arrange to hide me until the meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is the meeting going to be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the ship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as he looks out to his left, approaching an intersection. From driver's viewpoint. A C. and R. car is parked in the side street, facing the intersection, its occupants armed and helmeted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abreast of the intersection now, he looks to his right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting over the rear of a jeep which is halted in a side street facing the intersection. The cab crosses the intersection and the jeep driver squints to catch its number. Then he picks up his radio and speaks into the transmitter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (The car is still in front of the boardinghouse.) The Colonel listens to his radio for a moment, then speaks into his transmitter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... license number of target vehicle is W 4936... All vehicles maintain your positions -- and hold your fire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT shooting at the driver, over the shoulders of Klaatu and Helen, as he turns and points out the Army vehicles to them with a shrug of bewilderment. They look ahead at the intersection they are approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking ahead out of her side of the cab, at the intersection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from Helen's viewpoint. There is an Army vehicle waiting in the side street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he looks out of his side of the cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this side street, too, an Army vehicle is standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their eyes meet for a moment, neither willing to conjecture what this might mean. The very quietness of the operation is ominous and menacing. Their faces show grave concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5 -- report when target vehicle passes your position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT shooting through the window at Helen and Klaatu, who are growing more tense and nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting over the back of a jeep mounting a machine gun as the cab passes the intersection. The driver picks up his radio and reports into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - WEAPONS CARRIER shooting through the windshield as the driver reports by radio, his eyes shifting to follow the moving cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is biting her lips nervously. She steals a sidelong glance at Klaatu to find him staring ahead, deeply preoccupied and concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen nods, repeating the words soundlessly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (trying to give him encouragement) It's only a few blocks to Barnhardt's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm worried about Gort. I'm afraid of what he might do -- if anything should happen to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gort? (puzzled) But he's a robot. I mean -- without you, what could he do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly) There's no limit to what he could do. He could destroy the Earth. (with great urgency) If anything should happen to me, you must go to Gort. You must give him this message: "Klaatu barada nikto." Please repeat that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked and bewildered, she repeats nervously) "Klaatu barada nikto."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gravely) Remember those words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of vehicle drivers reporting by radio as their eyes follow the progress of the taxi. (These should be shot so we don't hear what is said.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: listening to these reports. Then he speaks into his transmitter with quiet tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel motions to his driver and the staff car pulls out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into radio) Attention, Zone 5... Section number 2 -- block off Tenth Street at Massachusetts. All vehicles close in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as a convoy of eight vehicles moves down the street going very fast and swings around a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of individual vehicles that have been waiting at intersections, as they pull out and down the main streets to converge on the taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at a major intersection, as the convoy of eight vehicles previously seen dashes through the intersection and stops. The cars quickly arrange themselves so that they form a roadblock, completely sealing off the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting over the driver's shoulder. The cab is proceeding down the street. When the road block comes into range of its headlights. The driver, who has been getting uneasy, turns to face his fares accusingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he slows his cab down, Helen leans forward into scene. Frenzied, she is about to urge the driver on when Klaatu puts a restraining hand on her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, what's this all about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shooting down the street from the barricade, as the taxi stops. Army cars are closing in behind the taxi, so it is trapped. The cab door ovens and Klaatu steps out, making a run for the entrance to a pedestrian underpass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - JEEP It is one of the lead vehicles in the group coming up behind the taxi. It mounts a .30 caliber machine gun and, with the Jeep still moving, the gunner fires a burst at Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - RIFLEMAN He's on one of the vehicles that form the barricade. He takes a bead on the running figure of Klaatu and fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has almost reached the underpass. His hand is on the railing when he slumps to the ground, badly hit. In a moment, Helen rushes into scene, dropping down to hold Klaatu's head in her arms. He looks up at her with a feeble smile. Then his face takes on an expression of urgency.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu is unable to say any more. He is dead. Helen looks around wildly, helplessly, with tears and terror in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (weakly, insistently) Get that message to Gort. Right away--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the soldiers pile out of their vehicles and close in on the place where Klaatu lies. He is their first and all- important concern, and Helen finds herself pushed out of the way, toward the edge of the growing crowd of soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shocked and, staggered by what's happened, she realizes she must get to Gort. Taking advantage of the milling confusion in the dark, she edges toward the pedestrian underpass until she can slip into its entrance without being noticed. And she disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the eerie light of the huge building, the great robot stands encased in a solid block of clear, transparent plastic. As CAMERA MOVES IN slowly, we hear a low whirring sound, as of power being generated. A faint glow, visible through the plastic, emanates from Gort's body. His eyes, which seem to express rage, shifts as though he were straining to break out. As the whirring sound and the glow of Gort's body increase in intensity, the sharp edges at the top of the ice- like block melt into roundness and the plastic starts to drip away. (About 150 folding chairs are arranged on the floor near the space ship for the meeting tonight.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - TWO SOLDIERS The whirring sound can be heard faintly from inside. The two soldiers standing guard at the door hear the sound and listen apprehensively. The two men exchange an uneasy glance. After hesitating a moment, one of them decides to investigate. He turns and goes inside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - THE SOLDIER As he stops and looks up at the robot, his eyes go wide with terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gort is an awesome and terrifying sight. His head is free now and he seems to be straining against the plastic, which is dripping down the sides of the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances around nervously to see that his companion has entered the building and is staring up at the robot, bug- eyed. Slowly the second soldier moves up beside the first. Wordlessly, they bring their rifles up to the ready and click them off safety. In spite of their terror, they advance slowly toward the robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whirring sound is ominous and his body glows brightly. And his eyes are fixed on the two advancing figures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - TWO SOLDIERS as they move toward Gort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside him comes a new and terribly sharp crackling. sound. And from his eyes two pencils of light dart out. After a moment the crackling sound stops and the light goes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from same angle as scene before last. But the two soldiers have utterly disappeared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Gort resumes breaking out of the plastic. There is no sign of the two soldiers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - HELEN - NIGHT Hurrying along a footpath, nervous and distraught, she pauses for a moment, looking at the entrance of the building. Then she starts determinedly across the grass toward the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PANNING with Helen as she approaches the entrance fearfully. Rallying all her courage and determination, she forces herself to step inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - HELEN as she enters the huge, weirdly lighted building. She stops short as her glance falls on the awesome figure of Gort. Loneliness and terror grip her and she wants to run -- but she realizes she can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT -GORT He has seen Helen and his flashing eyes bore into her. His upper body and arms are free now, and the plastic is rapidly melting away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is held fascinated by the robot's staring eyes. For another moment it looks as if she would, break and run. But she summons all her courage, and moves slowly toward Gort, whose legs are still held captive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she moves slowly, fearfully toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - GORT The plastic is dripping off his legs now. With great effort, he pulls his legs free and steps out of the stuff. A huge figure in the heavy shadows, he moves slowly and menacingly toward Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - HELEN as she stops advancing, rooted to the spot in fear. Then she starts backing away, keeping her eyes on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the great, hulking figure approaches, Helen can't stand her ground. She turns and runs wildly toward the far end of the building. Gort follows her with unhurried, inescapable strides. Unwittingly, Helen has run into a corner, and the robot is closing in on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - HELEN Her eyes go wide with terror as she realizes she's trapped. In a wild effort to run around him, she stumbles and falls to the floor. Immobilized with fright, she lies breathless, looking up at him. Then she gives a piercing scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the great robot bends over her menacingly, arms outstretched as though to grab or smash her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hope gone, she is blessed with a moment of lucidity, and she remembers the message Klaatu told her to deliver.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gort--! (with desperate clarity) Klaatu -- barada -- nikto.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He pauses as he hears the words. His face doesn't change expression, but the words obviously have an effect on him. He hesitates thoughtfully for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen watches him in an agony of suspense. Then the robot slowly bends down, picks her up in his arms and starts walking toward the space ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PANNING with Gort as he carries Helen, speechless with fright, to the side of the ship. He touches the side, and the ramp moves slightly out. He mounts the ramp, still carrying Helen, and disappears into the ship with her. And the ramp closes silently behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Gort carries Helen through the dimly lighted corridor into the main cabin, where he flips a switch that lights up the cabin. The robot proceeds to a small door leading off the main cabin and disappears with Helen inside it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is revealed as a weirdly equipped laboratory, the walls of which are lined with the most complex array of mechanical and electronic apparatus. Gort sets Helen down on a stool and indicates for her to stay there. Too terrified to move, Helen watches as he busies himself with the apparatus. He starts flipping switches and turning dials. As a result, lights begin to flash and there's a strange series of mechanical noises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unable to guess the reason for these preparations, she is gripped with a terrible fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignoring Helen completely, Gort finishes his work. Then he moves to the door and goes out, closing the door behind him. Helen rushes to the door and searches frantically for the knob -- only to find, to her terror, that there is none. Frenziedly she beats on the solid metal door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the ramp comes down and Gort steps out. With grim, determined strides he starts toward the entrance of the building as the ramp silently closes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel who was in charge of Klaatu's apprehension is speaking into a phone at the desk of the Police Sergeant. Standing by are three or four Army officers, among them a Captain and a Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The General has apparently hung up and the Colonel does likewise, turning to the officers in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two officers mutter their "yes, sirs" and start off about their business.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Yes, sir, we've got the body here now. Downstairs in a cell... No question about it, General -- he's dead all right... Yes, sir. Yes -- I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: General Cutler's coming down here right away. (to the Lieutenant) Take a squad of men, Lieutenant, and post a guard around that cell. (to Captain) Captain, don't let anyone in or out of the building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A squad of armed soldiers, led by the lieutenant, is admitted to the corridor by a Police guard and they start marching down the corridor toward a cell at the far end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a cell on the ground floor. In the far wall is a heavily barred window, beyond which is as alley. In f.g. are Klaatu's feet, stretched out on a crude table. As CAMERA HOLDS, the huge figure of Gort appears outside the barred window, Seeing Klaatu, he reaches up and yanks out the steel bars as though they were chicken wire. With a crushing blow of his knee he crumbles the brick and mortar below the window and steps inside the cell. He moves without interruption toward the body of Klaatu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hearing the sounds of clattering metal and mortar, the soldiers race down the corridor toward the cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting over the backs of the soldiers as they reach the cell and look inside. There they see the giant robot picking up the body of Klaatu and starting deliberately toward the gaping hole in the side of the building. They raise their weapons and fire at Gort, but the bullets have no effect on him. Continuing uninterruptedly, he steps over the debris and disappears, carrying Klaatu in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Gort enters the empty building, still carrying the body of Klaatu. CAMERA PANS with him as he strides over to the ship. The ramp opens and Gort goes inside. Then the ramp closes after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alone in the cabin, Helen is still terrified. She looks up, startled as the door opens and Gort enters, carrying Klaatu's body over to a long counter. Once again he starts fiddling with knobs, switches and dials. As Helen watches, speechless, he starts to fasten strange-looking electrodes to Klaatu's wrist and ankle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting from the outside, near the front entrance to the building, through a window into the main room where the Police Sergeant's desk is. The Lieutenant who was ordered to guard Klaatu's cell is excitedly reporting to the Colonel how Gort broke in and took Klaatu's body. Considerably agitated, the Colonel snaps orders to the other officers, glances at his watch and motions for the Lieutenant to follow him. He and the Lieutenant cross to the door and CAMERA PANS with them as they come outside the building, hurry down the steps and get into a staff car. Several other Army vehicles join the staff car as it roars away from the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good many of the 150 chairs are filled, and more guests are still arriving. There is no one to greet them at the door, so they wander in and seat themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gort is still working over the body of Klaatu. From a socket in the wall he pulls a strange-looking hypodermic needle on the end of a cord or tube and gives Klaatu a shot in the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she watches, fascinated in spite of her terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gort fiddles with the dials again and there are electrical cracklings and sputterings. Suddenly he flips a switch and all sound ceases. Gort removes the electrodes and watches Klaatu. CAMERA MOVES IN on Klaatu and we see him start to breathe. In a moment his eyelids flutter. Then his eyes open and he looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT as Klaatu slowly lifts himself to a sitting position. Helen watches breathlessly as he glances around the room, as though to orient himself. Then he lowers his feet to the floor and stands up. He blinks uncertainly, then smiles at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu moves one of the sliding panels and reaches for a suit of his "other world" clothing from behind the panel. With a nod of apology, he steps behind the panel to change.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with a grateful glance at Gort, he turns to Helen) Hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring at him)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nodding, with a smile) I was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Gort in awe) You mean he has the power of life and death?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- that is a power reserved to the Almighty Spirit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the equipment Gort used) This technique, in certain cases, can re-stimulate life for a limited period. It's a refinement of scientific principles known to your own people.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (concerned for him) But how -- how long--?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long will I live? (he shrugs) That no one can say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shooting from the door. In f.g. Barnhardt, who has just arrived, is greeting several friends outside the door. In b.g. a staff car and three or four other Army vehicles are driving up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the convoy pulls up to a halt in front of the building, the Colonel hurries out of the staff car and moves over to Barnhardt. Barnhardt is motioning his friends into the building as the Colonel comes up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Colonel speaks to Barnhardt with deference but with unyielding authority.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Professor Barnhardt -- I have to ask you to call off this meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call it off? I... But I had permission from the Army--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you did. But the robots on the loose now and it isn't safe around here. You'll have to get your friends out of that building.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as Klaatu steps out from behind the sliding panel where he has changed into his "other world" tunic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen is genuinely upset at the thought of his leaving and the knowledge that he is to die. There is a compelling warmth of feeling between these two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu looks at her in warm, considered admiration. Then he moves to one side of the cabin and flips a switch. Suddenly an entire section of the side wall is made transparent. Through it, as through a screen, we can see out into the building. Most of the chairs are already occupied, and latecomers are still moving in through the door. Facing the group, on a little dais, is Barnhardt. As Klaatu and Helen watch, Barnhardt raps for order and begins to speak. His voice comes in the ship through a speaker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gort and I will be leaving soon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (simply, sincerely) We'll miss you very much -- Bobby and I. (smiling to conceal her real feelings) He won't have anyone to play with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll have you -- and Tom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly -- definitely) No. That's all finished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (she is sensible and objective, but not unfeeling) I think I'm very lucky. You don't always get a chance to recognize a mistake before you make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ladies and Gentlemen--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - BARNHARDT He addresses them gravely, with a note of terrible disappointment in his voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I called you from your work and from your homes all over the world because we were to meet here tonight with a man from another planet -- the man who came here in this ship. (there are audible exclamations of surprise and disappointment) As you all know, this is no longer possible. I can only say that I share the bitterness of your disappointment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: with the above are group and individual shots of the people in the meeting. They are the cream of Earth's intellectuals -- scientists, churchmen, educators, leaders of social and political thought. There are several women among them. There are turbaned Indians, Chinese, Japanese, several Negroes. All religions are represented. Every important world power is represented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klaatu and Helen are watching and listening, as the last sentence of Barnhardt's speech above comes over the speaker. Klaatu flips off the switch, which cuts off the view of the meeting and also Barnhardt's voice. At this moment Gort moves across the cabin and Klaatu speaks to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gort moves off obediently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gort -- berengo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - BARNHARDT Full of chagrin, he continues addressing the meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barnhardt is interrupted by the sudden and unexpected appearance of the ramp, silently opening out of the side of the space ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: --under the circumstances, the Army people have asked us to leave the building. And, since their concern is for our safety, I can do nothing but suggest that we comply--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as they react in startled amazement to the mysterious appearance of the ramp. Then, as they watch, there is a sudden gasp of terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Gort appears on the ramp and walks slowly down to the ground. In a moment, Klaatu and Helen appear at the entrance of the ship. Helen comes down the ramp to join Barnhardt, while Klaatu remains at the head of the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT COLONEL AND SOLDIERS The Colonel stands near the door, flanked by a group of soldiers, their rifles at the ready. The Colonel is startled by what he sees. His eyes are on the revered figure of Klaatu and he's debating what he should do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU He is a figure of intense dignity in his impressive otherworld tunic. He stares with even defiance at the armed soldiers, as though holding them off by sheer weight of his personality. He turns to look out at the audience, which is held spellbound. Then, after a breathless moment, he speaks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (straightforwardly, with almost stern authority) I am leaving soon and you will forgive me if I speak bluntly. (he pauses, studying the faces) The Universe grows smaller every day -- and the threat of aggression by any group -- anywhere -- can no longer be tolerated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - IN AUDIENCE of three of the delegates, listening intently. (These three are from Russia, India and France.)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) There must be security for all -- or no one is secure... This does not mean giving up any freedom except the freedom to act irresponsibly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is an American.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) Your ancestors knew this when they made laws to govern themselves -- and hired policemen to enforce them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We of the other planets have long accepted this principle. We have an organization for the mutual protection of all planets -- and for the complete elimination of aggression. A sort of United Nations on the Planetary level... The test of any such higher authority, of course, is the police force that supports it. For our policemen, we created a race of robots-- (indicating Gort) Their function is to patrol the planets -- in space ships like this one -- and preserve the peace. In matters of aggression we have given them absolute power over us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - GORT emphasizing his great size and inscrutable expression. The normal blinking of his piercing eyes as he gazes imperturbably at the audience is his only movement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (over scene) At the first sign of violence they act automatically against the aggressor. And the penalty for provoking their action is too terrible to risk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The result is that we live in peace, without arms or armies, secure in the knowledge that we are free from aggression and war -- free to pursue more profitable enterprises. (after a pause) We do not pretend to have achieved perfection -- but we do have a system -- and it works. (with straightforward candor) I came here to give you the facts. It is no concern of ours how you run your own planet -- but if you threaten to extend your violence, this Earth of yours will be reduced to a burned- out cinder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of four delegates, reflecting their stark terror and bewilderment. And a cut of the Colonel and the soldiers, impressed and held by what Klaatu is saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT - KLAATU CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY as he concludes quietly, incisively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time he reads the last line, the CAMERA HAS MOVED INTO a BIG HEAD CLOSEUP.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your choice is simple. Join us and live in peace. Or pursue your present course -- and face obliteration. (after a pause) We will be waiting for your answer. decision rests with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: along a row of their faces, stunned and silent, their minds unable to cope with the enormity of what they have heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA MOVES IN on Klaatu as he is saying goodbye to Barnhardt and Helen. He turns then and speaks to Gort, glancing up at the building as he does so.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gort -- veracto.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He looks up at the roof of the building, and once again we hear the peculiar generating sound from within him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT including the delegates, the space ship, everything that is inside the building. As we watch, the roof and walls of the temporary structure suddenly disintegrate as the tanks did in the opening. The entire layout -- delegates, space ship and all -- remain exactly as they were except that instead of being under a roof they are out in the open Mall under a starry sky. The area is ringed with the debris of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AT SHIP Klaatu is standing at the head of the ramp as Gort comes up the ramp and disappears inside the ship. Klaatu is nodding goodbye to Barnhardt and Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they wave to Klaatu. Barnhardt is moved and impressed, and Helen's face shows her emotions at this strange parting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods and smiles at them with warm affection. Then he turns and disappears into the ship, and the ramp closes behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside the ship comes the muffled roar of great power generating -- not the sound of earthly motors, but of a tremendous dynamo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching breathless, stunned by what they have heard and seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - THE SHIP As the sound from inside it builds to a climax, the great ship takes off with a tremendous roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All are deeply moved and impressed. In the mind of each is the burning question that Klaatu has posed for them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it soars away into the inky blackness of the outer spaces from which it came.
direction.name: direction
